snippet: The company, which is partly owned by Daimler, has selected HSBC, Citic Securities International, Deutsche Bank and UBS, according to a prospectus.
abstract: BAIC Motor, which is partly owned by Daimler, has hired four banks for initial public offering in Hong Kong worth up to $2 billion; BAIC Motor is the passenger-car unit of Chinese state-owned Beijing Automotive Group.
lead_paragraph: The company, which is partly owned by Daimler, has selected HSBC, Citic Securities International, Deutsche Bank and UBS, according to a prospectus.

headline.main: China’s BAIC Motor Hires Banks for a $2 Billion I.P.O.
headline.print_headline: China’s BAIC Motor Plans for a $2 Billion I.P.O.
